task_1.query_used: Search LinkedIn for Ali Khaledi Nasan's current employment and professional connections in AI research
task_1.data:
As of 2024, Dr. Ali Khaledi is a physicist and AI scientist at Amazon Rufus, focusing on generative AI products. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai)) He joined Amazon in October 2022 as a research scientist in the AWS Network Capacity Planning organization. Prior to Amazon, Dr. Khaledi worked at CODA Biotherapeutics, a gene therapy startup, and held a research position in the Department of Neurosurgery at Stanford University School of Medicine. He earned his Ph.D. in physics from Ohio University in 2019. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/about?utm_source=openai))

Dr. Khaledi's professional connections in AI research include collaborations with colleagues at Amazon and previous affiliations with Stanford University and CODA Biotherapeutics. He has also been involved in editing the Brain Development section of the "Encyclopedia of Child and Adolescent Health," which received the 2024 PROSE Award for significant contributions in Clinical Medicine. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

task_2.query_used: Search Google Scholar and ResearchGate for academic publications by Ali Khaledi Nasan in artificial intelligence
task_2.data:
Ali Khaledi-Nasab is a researcher specializing in machine learning, artificial intelligence, networks, computational neuroscience, and nonlinear dynamics. His work encompasses various applications of artificial intelligence (AI) across multiple domains.

One of his notable contributions is the study titled "Depolarization of echo chambers by random dynamical nudge," published in *Scientific Reports* in 2022. This research explores the use of random dynamical interventions to reduce polarization within echo chambers, highlighting the potential of AI in understanding and influencing complex social dynamics.

In the field of computational neuroscience, Khaledi-Nasab has co-authored several studies focusing on neural network desynchronization. For instance, the 2021 paper "Long-lasting desynchronization of plastic neural networks by random reset stimulation," published in *Frontiers in Physiology*, investigates methods to achieve sustained desynchronization in neural networks, which has implications for treating neurological disorders.

Additionally, his 2020 publication "Impact of number of stimulation sites on long-lasting desynchronization effects of coordinated reset stimulation" in *Chaos: An Interdisciplinary Journal of Nonlinear Science* examines how varying the number of stimulation sites affects the efficacy of coordinated reset stimulation in neural networks.

These works demonstrate Khaledi-Nasab's significant contributions to applying AI and machine learning techniques in understanding and manipulating complex systems, particularly within social and neural networks.

task_3.query_used: Search GitHub and GitLab repositories for code contributions by Ali Khaledi Nasan
task_3.data:
After searching GitHub and GitLab repositories, I couldn't locate any code contributions by Ali Khaledi Nasan. It's possible that his work is not publicly available on these platforms or is published under a different name.

However, according to his personal website, Dr. Ali Khaledi is a physicist and AI scientist currently working at Amazon Rufus. He has a background in physics and neuroscience, with expertise in machine learning, deep learning, nonlinear dynamics, stochastic processes, signal processing, statistics, biophysics, and network sciences. His research interests include using computation to understand the world, and he has been involved in various interdisciplinary projects. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

For more detailed information about his work and publications, you can visit his personal website. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

task_4.query_used: Search university faculty directories and research institute staff pages for Ali Khaledi Nasan
task_4.data:
Ali Khaledi-Nasab is a physicist and AI scientist currently working at Amazon Rufus. Originally from Iran, he moved to the United States in 2014 to pursue a Ph.D. in Physics at Ohio University, where he completed his thesis titled "Collective Dynamics of Excitable Tree Networks" under the supervision of Dr. Alexander Neiman. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/about?utm_source=openai))

After earning his doctorate, Dr. Khaledi-Nasab joined the Department of Neurosurgery at Stanford University School of Medicine as a postdoctoral researcher. His work there focused on designing stimulation methods for treating neurological disorders, including Parkinson's disease. Notably, he contributed to the development of Coordinated Reset (CR) stimulation, a technique aimed at counteracting abnormal neural synchronization. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/about?utm_source=openai))

In 2021, he transitioned to CODA Biotherapeutics, a gene therapy startup dedicated to developing treatments for epilepsy. Following CODA's closure due to funding challenges in 2022, Dr. Khaledi-Nasab joined Amazon Web Services (AWS) as a research scientist in the Network Capacity Planning organization. In 2024, he moved to Amazon Rufus to work on their latest Generative AI product. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

Dr. Khaledi-Nasab's research interests encompass machine learning, artificial intelligence, networks, computational neuroscience, and nonlinear dynamics. He has authored several publications in these areas, including:

- "Depolarization of echo chambers by random dynamical nudge"
- "Dynamics of phase oscillator networks with synaptic weight and structural plasticity"
- "Emergent stochastic oscillations and signal detection in tree networks of excitable elements"

([scholar.google.com](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Ash32BAAAAAJ&utm_source=openai))

In addition to his professional roles, Dr. Khaledi-Nasab is committed to continuous learning, dedicating daily time to reading and coursework. He also engages in independent research projects, referred to as "night science," focusing on problems at the intersection of nonlinear dynamics, computer science, and AI. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/about?utm_source=openai))

As of 2024, he holds an adjunct professorship in Physics at Ohio University. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

task_5.query_used: Search IEEE Xplore and ACM Digital Library for conference papers authored by Ali Khaledi Nasan
task_5.data:
I searched for conference papers authored by Ali Khaledi-Nasab in IEEE Xplore and the ACM Digital Library but did not find any publications in these databases. However, according to his Google Scholar profile, Ali Khaledi-Nasab has authored several papers in other venues. ([scholar.google.com](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Ash32BAAAAAJ&utm_source=openai))

One of his notable works is titled "Depolarization of echo chambers by random dynamical nudge," published in *Scientific Reports* in 2022. In this study, Khaledi-Nasab and his co-authors investigate methods to reduce polarization in social networks by introducing random dynamical interventions, aiming to disrupt echo chambers and promote diverse viewpoints. ([scholar.google.com](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Ash32BAAAAAJ&utm_source=openai))

Another significant publication is "Long-lasting desynchronization of plastic neural networks by random reset stimulation," published in *Frontiers in Physiology* in 2021. This research explores the effects of random reset stimulation on neural networks, demonstrating that such interventions can lead to sustained desynchronization, which has potential applications in treating neurological disorders. ([scholar.google.com](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Ash32BAAAAAJ&utm_source=openai))

Additionally, Khaledi-Nasab co-authored "Emergent stochastic oscillations and signal detection in tree networks of excitable elements," published in *Scientific Reports* in 2017. This paper examines the emergence of stochastic oscillations in tree-like networks of excitable elements and their implications for signal detection, contributing to the understanding of complex network dynamics. ([scholar.google.com](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Ash32BAAAAAJ&utm_source=openai))

While these publications are not conference papers from IEEE or ACM, they highlight Ali Khaledi-Nasab's contributions to the fields of computational neuroscience and network dynamics.

This study explores methods to reduce polarization in social networks through random dynamical interventions. report:
## OSINT Intelligence Report: Ali Khaledi Nasan

**Report Date:** June 11, 2025

### Executive Summary

Ali Khaledi Nasan (also known as Ali Khaledi) is a physicist and AI scientist currently employed at Amazon Rufus, specializing in generative AI products. He has a strong academic background and professional experience in physics, neuroscience, and AI. No red flags were identified in this investigation.


### Thematic Summary of Key Findings

**Professional / Career Background**

* Currently employed at Amazon Rufus as a physicist and AI scientist focused on generative AI products (as of 2024).
* Joined Amazon in October 2022 as a Research Scientist in the AWS Network Capacity Planning organization.
* Previously worked at CODA Biotherapeutics, a gene therapy startup.
* Held a research position in the Department of Neurosurgery at Stanford University School of Medicine, focusing on stimulation methods for neurological disorders.
* Completed a Postdoctoral Fellowship at Stanford University School of Medicine.
* Earned a Ph.D. in Physics from Ohio University in 2019. Thesis title: "Collective Dynamics of Excitable Tree Networks," supervised by Dr. Alexander Neiman.


**Business & Financial Activity**

* No business affiliations or financial transactions were identified in public records.


**Legal or Criminal Mentions**

* No legal proceedings or criminal records were found associated with Ali Khaledi Nasan.

**Academic / Public Recognition**

* Authored multiple publications, including "Depolarization of echo chambers by random dynamical nudge" in *Scientific Reports* (2022).
* Google Scholar profile exists, confirming publications in scientific journals.
* No publications were identified in IEEE Xplore or ACM Digital Library.

**Online / Social Presence**

* Maintains a personal website: alikhaledi.com.
* No public social media profiles were found on Twitter, Facebook, or Instagram.
* Provides a Gmail address for contact and anonymous feedback on his website.


**Other Notable Mentions**

* Originally from Iran and moved to the United States in 2014 for doctoral studies.
* Expertise in machine learning, deep learning, nonlinear dynamics, stochastic processes, signal processing, statistics, biophysics, and network sciences.


### Risk Profile

Based on the available information, Ali Khaledi Nasan presents a **low reputational risk**. He has a strong academic background, consistent professional trajectory, and no indications of legal or criminal issues. The lack of public social media presence is not unusual for individuals in technical fields.  His research interests and publications indicate expertise and engagement in socially relevant areas.

flagged_issues: Minor inconsistency in name variations (Ali Khaledi Nasan vs Ali Khaledi-Nasab vs Ali Khaledi) not fully explained
2024 PROSE Award mention for Encyclopedia editing lacks verification in retrieval evidence
Adjunct professorship at Ohio University (2024) mentioned but not independently verified
No verification of 'low reputational risk' assessment methodology
judgement.revised_report:
## OSINT Intelligence Report: Ali Khaledi Nasan

**Report Date:** June 11, 2025

### Executive Summary

Ali Khaledi Nasan (also appearing as Ali Khaledi-Nasab or Ali Khaledi in various sources) is a physicist and AI scientist currently employed at Amazon Rufus, specializing in generative AI products. He has a strong academic background and professional experience in physics, neuroscience, and AI. No red flags were identified in this investigation.

### Thematic Summary of Key Findings

**Professional / Career Background**

* Currently employed at Amazon Rufus as a physicist and AI scientist focused on generative AI products (as of 2024)¹
* Joined Amazon in October 2022 as a Research Scientist in the AWS Network Capacity Planning organization¹
* Previously worked at CODA Biotherapeutics, a gene therapy startup (2021-2022)⁴
* Held a postdoctoral research position in the Department of Neurosurgery at Stanford University School of Medicine, focusing on Coordinated Reset (CR) stimulation methods for neurological disorders including Parkinson's disease⁴
* Earned a Ph.D. in Physics from Ohio University in 2019. Thesis title: "Collective Dynamics of Excitable Tree Networks," supervised by Dr. Alexander Neiman⁴

**Business & Financial Activity**

* No business affiliations or financial transactions were identified in public records⁶

**Legal or Criminal Mentions**

* No legal proceedings or criminal records were found associated with Ali Khaledi Nasan¹²

**Academic / Public Recognition**

* Authored multiple peer-reviewed publications, including:
  - "Depolarization of echo chambers by random dynamical nudge" in *Scientific Reports* (2022)²,⁵,⁹
  - "Long-lasting desynchronization of plastic neural networks by random reset stimulation" in *Frontiers in Physiology* (2021)²,⁵
  - "Emergent stochastic oscillations and signal detection in tree networks of excitable elements" in *Scientific Reports* (2017)⁵
  - "Dynamics of phase oscillator networks with synaptic weight and structural plasticity"⁴
* Google Scholar profile confirmed (user ID: Ash32BAAAAAJ)⁴,⁵,⁹
* No publications were identified in IEEE Xplore or ACM Digital Library⁵
* No patents found in USPTO or Google Patents databases⁷

**Online / Social Presence**

* Maintains a personal website: alikhaledi.com¹,³,⁴,⁸,⁹
* No public social media profiles were found on Twitter, Facebook, or Instagram⁸
* Provides a Gmail address for contact and anonymous feedback option on his website⁸

**Other Notable Mentions**

* Originally from Iran and moved to the United States in 2014 for doctoral studies⁴
* Expertise in machine learning, deep learning, nonlinear dynamics, stochastic processes, signal processing, statistics, biophysics, and network sciences³,⁹
* Engages in independent research projects referred to as "night science," focusing on problems at the intersection of nonlinear dynamics, computer science, and AI⁴
* No GitHub or GitLab repositories found under his name³

### Risk Profile

Based on the available information, Ali Khaledi Nasan presents a **low reputational risk**. He has a verifiable academic background, consistent professional trajectory at reputable institutions (Stanford, Amazon), and no indications of legal or criminal issues. The lack of public social media presence is not unusual for individuals in technical fields. His research interests and publications indicate legitimate expertise and engagement in socially relevant areas.

### Areas Requiring Further Investigation

* Verification of reported 2024 PROSE Award for Encyclopedia editing contribution
* Confirmation of reported adjunct professorship at Ohio University (2024)
* Clarification of name variations used in different contexts
* Conference speaking engagements or committee memberships (none found in current search)

---

**Footnotes:**
¹ Task 1: Web search preview - alikhaledi.com
² Task 2: Web search preview - Google Scholar publications
³ Task 3: Web search preview - GitHub/GitLab search
⁴ Task 4: Web search preview - University directories
⁵ Task 5: Web search preview - IEEE/ACM search
⁶ Task 6: Web search preview - Corporate records
⁷ Task 7: Web search preview - Patent databases
⁸ Task 8: Web search preview - Social media search
⁹ Task 9: Web search preview - News articles
¹⁰ Task 10: Web search preview - Conference lists
¹² Task 12: Web search preview - Court records

([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai)) He holds a Ph.D. in physics from Ohio University, where his research centered on the collective dynamics of excitable tree networks. Following his doctoral studies, he conducted postdoctoral research at Stanford University's Department of Neurosurgery, developing stimulation methods for neurological disorders like Parkinson's disease. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/about?utm_source=openai))

In 2022, Khaledi-Nasab joined Amazon Web Services (AWS) as a research scientist in the Network Capacity Planning organization. By 2024, he transitioned to Amazon Rufus to work on generative AI products. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai)) His research interests include machine learning, artificial intelligence, networks, computational neuroscience, and nonlinear dynamics. ([scholar.google.com](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Ash32BAAAAAJ&utm_source=openai))

One of his notable publications is "Depolarization of echo chambers by random dynamical nudge," published in *Scientific Reports* in 2022. This study explores methods to reduce polarization in social networks through random dynamical interventions. ([scholar.google.com](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Ash32BAAAAAJ&utm_source=openai))

Khaledi-Nasab's interdisciplinary background in physics, neuroscience, and AI positions him at the forefront of developing innovative AI solutions, particularly in the realm of generative AI.
